estonian.text: Who never built a house thinks that the walls grow out of the ground.
Who eats lying on his side will commit ten sins, who eats lying on his back will commit seven sins.
Who eats will be strong.
Who falls from height will suffer a hard blow.
Who fears laughing will die of fart.
Who fears will lose.
Who flees from a wolf will find a bear with two sons instead.
Who gives to the poor will be rewarded by God for a hundred.
Who goes out begging with a bread will come back with a piece, who goes out with a piece will come back with a bread.
Who goes to catch a partridge will lose a hen.
Who goes to church without his axe is a shitty man.
The devil does not always wear boots -- he sometimes comes barefoot.
The fish who is in the weir will want out, who is outside will want inside the weir.
The law is three days older than the earth.
The man who can sharpen hundred stakes between two meals, can take a wife.
The mistakes of other people are good teachers.
The mistakes of others are good teachers.
The mouth is the interpreter for the heart.
The new boat will find the old stones.
The old man looks death in the eye, the young man keeps him behind his back.
The pipe is nearer than the wife.
A poor beggar is the one who begs without a bag.
Barking dogs don't catch hares.
Beauty does not fill your tummy.
Better a goat that can give milk than a cow that cannot.
Coal that does not burn gives little heat.
Do not choose your wife on your way to the church.
Don't put off today's work till tomorrow.
Earth is dearer than gold.
Earth is more precious than gold.
Give good and get good.
A debt is always new.
A dog who is called for, an honest man goes himself.
A girl who cannot patch man's trousers in between the legs, must not marry at all, because what use does a man have of such a stupid wife.
A girl without a needle is like a cat without a claw.
A good deed bears interest.
A good deed is written on snow.
A man is who knows to marry a woman and buy a horse.
A man who gets, a bitch who lets.
A man who has learned much is rich.
A much-used plow shines; stagnant waters stink.
You shall have the good that you bring.
Who can tie an oven brush, weave a sackcloth and turn over chitterlings is ready for marriage.
Who celebrates all holidays will face all hungers.
Who cheats is a dog, who lets himself be cheated is an ass.
Who cuddles a cat, his farmyard will be blessed.
Who dies threatening will be buried with farting.
Who disobeys his parents, disobeys God.
Who does not jump into water will not learn to swim.
Who does not notice you in rags will not notice you in nice clothes, who notices you in rags will also motice you in nice clothes.
Who does not obey forbidding will regret afterwards.
Who does not obey the parents' word will be taught by the world.
The stomach never gets full with licking.
The summer comes and kisses the child, the winter comes and kills it.
The town is new every day.
The wood is the poor man's coat.
The work will teach you how to do it.
There is no room for two kings in one castle.
They are not all men who wear trousers.
Wasting time is stealing from oneself.
When death comes, the rich man has no money and the poor man no debt.
When God gives a child, he also gives the clothing.
Who is born stupid will die stupid.
Who is careless will be unhappy.
Who is doomed to death will not be cured by medicines either.
Who is generous is lazy, who is angry is diligent.
Who is good will be rewarded.
Who is late will be left without.
Who is made to slave should do it with pleasure.
Who is man here will be a man there.
Who is oily is also cruel.
Who is oily is also stingy.
Who leaves the boat on water is miserable.
Who lets a woman slap him is as humiliated as if a pig has bitten.
Who lies that also steals.
Who lifts a dog's tail is a dog himself.
Who lives as a dog will die as a dog.
Who lives in lust will die in hunger for fat.
Who lives together with a pig will end up eating shit.
Who loans his ass to someone else should shit through his ribs.
Who looks for meat will find a bone.
Who grows up without fear will live without honour.
Who handles water is bound to get wet.
Who has been burned once is afraid of fire.
Who has burnt himself with soup will blow on water as well.
Who has done evil will answer for evil.
Who has gone out to the world will stay there.
Who has got a good wife has found a good thing.
Who has lied once will not be believed the second time.
Who has moved for three times has as if lived through a fire.
Who has not suffered from wounds will laugh at scars.
Who is out of sight is out of mind.
Who is quick in youth will be diligent in old age.
Who is smart will learn.
Who is soft will be sat on.
Who is stupid in the morning will be stupid in the evening.
Who is up to mischief will get beaten.
Who kills has to bury.
Who laughs at beggar's staff and roundhouse will be put to prison himself.
Who laughs early will cry later.
Who laughs will get a furuncle.
Who does not share what he is given will not share what he has in his barn.
Who does not thank for a little will not thank for a lot.
Who does not want to work, need not to eat.
Who does not work will not get food.
Who doesn't collect kopecks will not get a ruble.
Who doesn't want one will not get two.
Who eats a lot will do a lot.
Who eats a lot will make a mountain.
Who eats bread with barley porridge will be sent to Siberia.
Who eats like a wolf will work like a bear.
Where there is no fear, there is no pity.
Where there's work, there's bread.
Who asks a lot will get wiser.
Who begs for the sake of mischief steals from the God.
Who believes soon will be deceived soon as well.
Who bites with a lie will swallow with pain.
Who borrows a lot.
Who borrows has to pay back his debt.
Who bungles will get.
Who can not be trusted in small things can not be trusted in big things.
Who wants to teach others has to be learned himself.
Who wants will get.
Who weds a widow with three children takes four thieves into his house.
Who whisks himself on a Saturday will be punished by God.
Who works hard alone will gobble alone.
Who works hard will feel no hunger.
Who works in sweat will eat with appetite.
Whos's lazy when living will be lazy when dying.
Wise is who admits he is still ignorant.
You cannot eat downwind, you will get the chaff in your eyes.
Who shouts at home will bark away from home.
Who sows a wind will reap a storm.
Who sows evil shall reap perdition.
Who sows what shall reap that.
Who starts something has to finish it.
Who starts well will finish badly.
Who starts with small will end up with big.
Who steals that also lies.
Who strikes his father or mother his hand will grow out of the grave.
Who suffers will have no regrets.
In a garment made of silk there are no fleas.
It is a sheep who lets himself sheared.
It is better to be without a wife for a minute than without tobacco for an hour.
Justice knows no friendship.
Little kettles soon boil over.
Lo does not thank for little will thank for much.
Make fun of the man, not of his hat.
Man is after money, but money is after his soul.
Manure is the farmer's gold.
Old love does not rust.
Who has said 'yes' once already should not say 'no' any more.
Who has travelled a lot has seen a lot.
Who helps himself will be helped by God.
Who helps us in trouble is a true friend.
Who is a dog here will be a dog there.
Who is a dog will get dog's pay.
Who is a man for one thing will be a man for another.
Who is a piece of stick in youth will be a block of wood in old age.
Who is afraid of wolf should not go into the woods.
Who is angry with one is angry with the other.
Happy the marriage where the husband is the head and the wife the heart.
He who cooks the soup must eat it up himself.
He who rows goes far.
He who seeks shall find.
He who suffers the bitter will taste the sweet.
He who takes pains will get things done.
He's a fool who earns a square meal.
He's a fool who promises more than he can make.
If the bread in the oven is a failure you lose a week; if the harvest is a failure you lose a year; if marriage is a failure then you lose a life.
If you go only once round the room, you are wiser than he who sits still.
One cannot make soup out of beauty.
One woman never praises another.
Patience makes all hardships light.
Respect bread because bread is older than we are.
Silence is sometimes the answer.
Smart is the one who goes along with time, stupid is the one who bears his fangs.
Smart who smiles, stupid who laughs.
Sometimes silence is the proper answer.
The cat who snoops around will feed his kitten.
The cork is always bigger than the mouth of the bottle.
Who suffers will live long.
Who takes care of a cat will take care of a horse too.
Who takes care of a widow's 'hole' will inherit the heavenly kingdom.
Who talks a lot lies a lot.
Who talks a lot will be in trouble.
Who talks a lot will get little done.
Who toils and moils will be helped by God.
Who touches all will see many a thing.
Who wanders all the moors will taste all the berries.
Who wants to makes his friend his enemy should loan him some money.
Who promises a lot will regret a lot.
Who promises much will give little.
Who reminds of an old thing will have his eye picked out.
Who reminds of the past and recall what has been will have his ear cut off.
Who seeks shame will find shame.
Who seeks something will get that.
Who sees a mote in other's eye will not see a beam in his own eye.
Who sets a bug on its feet on the path will step up the staircase.
Who shares is a king.
Who shears the sheep's head will live a couple of days, who shears its tail will live a hundred years.
The devil does not always wear boots — he sometimes comes barefoot.
Who does not thank for little will thank for much.
Manure is the farmer’s gold.
The wood is the poor man’s coat.
When death comes, the rich man has no money and the poor man no debt.
The old man looks death in the eye, the young man keeps him behind his back.
The mistakes of others are good teachers.
Barking dogs don’t catch hares.
